info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 8:41PM EDT until August 07 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL HALIFAX COUNTY... At 841 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Halifax, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Weldon, Medoc Mountain State Park, South Weldon, Rosemary, Tillery and Roanoke Rapids Lake. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
